net.seninp.jmotif.sax

Class TSProcessor

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.seninp.jmotif.sax.TSProcessor

  • public class TSProcessor
extends java.lang.Object
    Implements algorithms for low-level data manipulation.
    Author:
    Pavel Senin

    • Method Detail

      • readFileColumn

        public static double[] readFileColumn(java.lang.String filename,
                                      int columnIdx,
                                      int sizeLimit)
                               throws java.lang.NumberFormatException,
                                      java.io.IOException,
                                      SAXException
        Reads timeseries from a file. Assumes that file has a single double value on every line. Assigned timestamps are the line numbers.
        Parameters:
        filename - The file to read from.
        columnIdx - The column index.
        sizeLimit - The number of lines to read, 0 == all.
        Returns:
        data.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - if error occurs.
        java.io.IOException - if error occurs.
        SAXException - if error occurs.

      • znorm

        public double[] znorm(double[] series,
                      double normalizationThreshold)
        Speed-optimized Z-Normalize routine, doesn't care about normalization threshold.
        Parameters:
        series - The timeseries.
        normalizationThreshold - the zNormalization threshold value.
        Returns:
        Z-normalized time-series.

      • paa

        public double[] paa(double[] ts,
                    int paaSize)
        Approximate the timeseries using PAA. If the timeseries has some NaN's they are handled as follows: 1) if all values of the piece are NaNs - the piece is approximated as NaN, 2) if there are some (more or equal one) values happened to be in the piece - algorithm will handle it as usual - getting the mean.
        Parameters:
        ts - The timeseries to approximate.
        paaSize - The desired length of approximated timeseries.
        Returns:
        PAA-approximated timeseries.

      • ts2String

        public char[] ts2String(double[] vals,
                        double[] cuts)
        Converts the timeseries into string using given cuts intervals. Useful for not-normal distribution cuts.
        Parameters:
        vals - The timeseries.
        cuts - The cut intervals.
        Returns:
        The timeseries SAX representation.

      • ts2Index

        public int[] ts2Index(double[] series,
                      Alphabet alphabet,
                      int alphabetSize)
               throws java.lang.Exception
        Convert the timeseries into the index using SAX cuts.
        Parameters:
        series - The timeseries to convert.
        alphabet - The alphabet to use.
        alphabetSize - The alphabet size in use.
        Returns:
        SAX representation of timeseries.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if error occurs.

      • reshape

        public double[][] reshape(double[][] a,
                          int n,
                          int m)
        Returns the m-by-n matrix B whose elements are taken column-wise from A. An error results if A does not have m*n elements.
        Parameters:
        a - the source matrix.
        n - number of rows in the new matrix.
        m - number of columns in the new matrix.
        Returns:
        reshaped matrix.
